result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel M Mancil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*First 45 days must be in jail, second 45 days can be served on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and the RISK Assessment.
*Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine of $100 plus costs
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Not be on premises of Walmart.
*Submit DNA Sample.
*Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Blessinger hearing held

This a Blessinger Hearing for a Committment Warrant that was issued for failure to pay fines, fees, or costs that were previously ordered by the Court.  
Court Case(s) #: 16CM31

Defendant appears by video from the jail.

Court questions the Defendant as to his/her reasons for failing to pay and his/her financial status.
Court informs the Defendant that serving time in jail will not reduce or eliminate the fine.

Defendant makes statement to the Court.
Defendant makes statement regarding repayment of financial obligation.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders defendant to pay 1/2 of the fine by July 21st and the balance in full by August 4, 2017.
Defendant may be released from jail upon signing a payment plan agreement.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Memo provided to defendant in re:  needed statement to show employer that she had been at Courthouse

Defendant Angel M Mancil in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 16CM31, 16CM202

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM31 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
16CM202 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CM31 Count 1 & 16CM202 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CM31 Count 2 and 16CM202 Count 2 are dismissed and read-in. 

State files restitution summary. 
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
16CM202 Count 1-
Pay $5 fine plus costs totaling $143.80. To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 

16CM31 Count 2 - 
90 days jail, STAYED
First 45 days must be in jail, second 45 days can be served on GPS Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and the RISK Assessment. 
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months: 
Pay restitution of $58.61 to Walmart.
Not be on the premises of Walmart. 
Pay fine of $100 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit DNA sample. 
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof. 
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 

Court advises post-conviction.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.

No contact with Walmart.

Defendant Angel M Mancil in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant would like to enter a plea today. 
Court questions the defendant re: waiver of counsel. 
Court enters NOT GUILTY  plea on defendant's behalf. 

State recommends a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
